body.name: Silk'n Soft Unbleached Bamboo Toilet Paper - Tree-Free Environment Safe Biodegradable Septic-Safe Strong Dependable Panda Friendly Absorbent Bathroom Tissue 3-Ply Chlorine Free (12 Rolls)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 6 hrs 10 mins
features: OH NATURAL: Tree-Free, 3-Ply, Double Roll, 100% Bamboo, Unbleached
WHY ECO FRIENDLY?: Produces 35% more oxygen per day then than trees, Requires no pesticides or fertilizers, Bamboo can grow up to 75 cm
IS IT REALLY SOFT?: Softer than leading traditional brands. Bamboo produces some of the world’s most luxurious fabrics

WHY BAMBOO?: Bamboo is more Eco-friendly than trees. Bamboo does not need pesticides or fertilizer. As a member of the grass family, it is one of the world’s fastest growing plants. Bamboo grows within months, Bamboo grows from shoots that are part of its root system. Bamboo helps slow global warming as it removes a vast amount of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

DOUBLE ROLL FACTS: As a 3-ply bathroom tissue roll, Silk’n Soft is equivalent to a 300-sheet standard roll. As a product of Canada, Silk’n Soft is the same size as the industry standard double-roll in the Canadian Marketplace.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Bamboo produces some of the world’s most luxurious fabrics and now we have taken this incredible resource to create a soft tissue. There is a better way…You can now enjoy a super soft and luxurious toilet paper without a single tree being cut or settling for inferior products made from recycled paper. The variety of Bamboo used in Silk’n Soft is not a food source for Panda Bears. Silk’n Soft has no effect on the habitat of Panda Bears.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Being tree-free, it's an eco-friendly choice that aligns with my commitment to a greener lifestyle. The unbleached quality ensures a natural and gentle touch, making it a win for both me and the environment. The biodegradable nature and septic-safe feature give me peace of mind, knowing I'm making responsible choices without compromising on quality. It is not the softest of toilet paper, to be honest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a bamboo product
reviews.reviewText: Hi all. I've tried all the white sensitive TPs out there, but they all break me out or irritate. I've tried many unbleached that did as well. Haven't found a perfect TP, but this is my softest or least irritating yet. More sustainable than tree paper too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty great tissue
reviews.reviewText: I really liked almost everything about this tissue. The texture is great with plenty of embossing. It's unbleached, which I consider a necessity. It holds up very well during use. It doesn't really seem to break down as quickly as I would like in the toilet but none of the brands I have preferred do. Even with that, I have had no issues with clogging the pipes. My only issue is the very small rolls that are wrapped as loosely as regular store tissue. All other bamboo tissue I have tried is very tightly wrapped, making for much more tissue per roll, and they are larger rolls than these, as well. It still lasts longer than a regular store roll because you use less, but it does make them more expensive to use, even though the cost for 12 rolls is lower initially. I honestly am not sure how great the difference in cost per use would be. Going on the merits of the tissue alone, and nothing else, it really is great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: No PFAS. Will definitely buy again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Unbleached clogged my 70 year old 3 inch drain pipes, but is the best I've tried!
reviews.reviewText: I actually love this UNBLEACHED Silk'N Soft TP, but... it clogged my drains and I had to have my landlord call in the professionals. 3 bottles of max strength drain cleaner/clog remover, a 6 foot snake, and a new wide plunger didn't do anything... I seem to be the only one who purchased the unbleached brown variety, so here's my review of it! For all the deets, read on! For the TL;DR peeps, scroll to the bottom of my review.I am trying to live a greener, cleaner lifestyle. I also have super sensitive skin, and wanted a better option for my bottom. I had used Charmin Ultra (Soft and Strong) over the years, and recently began to acquire a rash! While researching this phenomenon, I came across an article (which I fact checked to be true) about the impact that popular toilet paper brands have on the ancient Canadian forests, and I knew I had to change. I've been avoiding buying things in plastic as well, so the search was on for plastic free, tree free, bleach, dye and perfume free toilet paper.I bought Silk'N Soft because it is the highest rated tree free bamboo option available for softness and thickness. It is both soft AND thick, and a nice shade of natural brown, but it didn't break down in my 1950s little house. I am in the city, have good plumbing, but the pipes are only 3 inches. More modern homes have 4 - 6 inch pipes. A couple days after starting to use this TP, sewage started backing up from our basement floor drain. It was mortifying, considering I live with other people who discovered the mess! The only thing new or different that could have caused this clog was the bamboo TP. I also sampled 2 other brands of bamboo TP, and 1 brand of green tea TP. I decided to do the "jar test" and filled each jar 3/4 full of cool tap water, a square of each type of TP, and shook them up a bit. All fell apart instantly except Silk'N Soft Unbleached. That does say something for its strength, though! For the short time I was able to use it, it didn't pill or roll at all! I did a second test & let sit for 36 hours before shaking, with 3 squares of SnS, and the only signs of any breakdown were at the perforated seams. They didn't come completely apart, though! So that settled it. I'm currently looking into options as far as a return/refund.Had this TP broken down, it would have been the winner and favorite of all the types I tried. Despite the rougher looking texture, it was quite soft! It's very absorbent, resulting in having to use a fraction of the amount of "regular" TP. It used be made with sugarcane fiber and bamboo, but they removed the sugarcane before I could try it. I think that would have made it softer and maybe easier to break down? I'm not 100% on that, as both sugarcane & bamboo TP (this and Seedling) I wanted to try had the sugarcane removed from the formula. It came packaged in a cardboard box, which was better than plastic (IMO), but it was loaded with plastic packing tape! *cringe* The core is bigger than my other TPs, and it is bright white in contrast to the brown natural paper. I do not know what it is made of, but it appears to be cardboard.Pros:Tree free bamboo - YAY!UnbleachedDye FreeUnscentedFragrance FreeThickAbsorbentNice texture (could be a little less 'rugged' though)Cardboard/paper packagingCons:Doesn't break down quicklyPotential to clog pipesLots of plastic tape on outer packageLarge coreExpensive compared to other bamboo brandsThat's it! Of everything I tried, unless something changes in the future, I will be going with my second choice of bamboo paper that does break down, which is Who Gives a Crap. I also tried Seedling by Grove Co., Who Gives a Crap recycled, and MonkeyLips Green Tea, which turned out to have virgin tree pulp in it, so I can't currently recommend as an eco friendly option, but they are working on reformulating with bamboo instead of trees. Yay for progress! It is a lovely paper, especially for sensitive ladies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THE ABSORBENCY IS SUPER LEVEL !
reviews.reviewText: I REALLY LOVE THIS TOILET PAPER - THE VERY BEST I HAVE TRIED YET. I WILL BE BUYING THIS IN FUTURE AS IT IS EVEN BETTER THAN THE WHITE VERSION (WHICH IS SELLING AT A LOWER PRICE ON AMAZON WHICH I DO NOT UNDERSTAND !). THIS IS A BIT PRICEY BUT I CONSIDER IT BETTER TO PAY A LITTLE MORE FOR WHAT YOU WANT !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another brand I will keep buying.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to try another brand and I came across this product. I like it a lot. Soft, last longer than I expected. Love how the packaging is all recyclable. I will continue to buy this is the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Small rolls. Maybe a third less than some softer ones.
reviews.reviewText: The rolls are small. They are not incredibly soft. It is soft enough to get no points taken away. But it does get the job done and with less product used. Being unbleached, the color is disconcerting in the toilet - at first. I may buy it again and I have no problem with recommending it.
